subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 restructuring
msgSnippet: ... You don t know that, because you never heard from them.  And for all you know, all these potential users chose to use a different library than yours
messageBody:
On 10/31/05, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
> > Maybe, but how many people will already have been discouraged from using
> > your library just because you didn't give them enough hooks?
>
> In my experience? None. Zip Zero. Zilch. Not even once.


You don't know that, because you never heard from them. And for all you
know, all these potential users chose to use a different library than yours
because they had more freedom there.

And even if you could know this number for sure, just accept that other
people have different experiences than you do (among which, most of the
people who are participating in this thread, it seems).


But possible, which is why open source libraries are preferable.


That's a completely separate debate and in my experience, closed source
software is usually much better at publishing and maintaining API's than
open-source (Microsoft being a pretty good example), but let's save this for
another day.


--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
